sect1.dbk:para: DocBook roundtripping helps to create basic DocBook documents using familiar word processors. The intention of the project is to enable popular word processors, which use XML as their data representation, to create DocBook documents. By converting documents from these word processors into XML, it is possible to apply XSLT transformations to convert them into DocBook and viceversa.

The document should undergo pipeline processing when converting from Word to DocBook. The set of stylesheets(in XSLT 2.0) and the order of trasformations can be found at userguide.xml. Ideally the reverse process should have one stylesheet for each type of word processor. At this stage, a single stylesheet is there which converts from DocBook to WordML. Stylesheets are imported by some stylesheets. Refer User Guide for customization layer information.
There are four stylesheets used when converting from either Microsoft Word or Open Office to DdocBook.
The test documents used for stylesheet development can be found at /test folder.

note.dbk:para: Refer userguide.xml for more information about using the stylesheets.
